Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tonight is the Dundies, the annual employee awards night here at Dunder Mifflin. [holds up a trophy of a business man] And this is everybody's favorite day. Everybody looks forward to it, because, you know, a lot of the people here don't get trophies, very often. Like Meredith or Kevin, I mean, who's gonna give Kevin an award? Dunkin' Donuts? Plus, bonus, it's really, really funny. So I, you know, an employee will go home, and he'll tell his neighbor, "Hey, did you get an award?" And the neighbor will say, "No man. I mean, I slave all day and nobody notices me." Next thing you know, employee smells something terrible coming from neighbor's house. Neighbor's hanged himself due to lack of recognition. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, you ready for the... the Dundies?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ugh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what they say about a car wreck, where it's so awful you can't look away? The Dundies are like a car wreck that you want to look away, but you have to stare at it because your boss is making you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in a Fat Albert voice] Hey hey hey! It's Fat Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Fat Albert voice] Fat Halpert. [in normal voice] Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So why don't I take you on a tour of past Dundie winners. We got Fat Jim Halpert here. Jim, why don't you show of your Dundies to the camera?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I can't because I keep them hidden. I don't want to look at them and get cocky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mine are at home in a display case above my bed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gyaaah. T.M.I. T.M.I my friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: T.M.I.? Too much information. Ah, it's just easier to say T.M.I. I used to say "Don't go there" but that's... lame.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And here we have Stanley the Manly. Now Stanley is a Dundie all-star, aren't you Stan? Why don't you, ah, show them some of your bling.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know where they are, I think I threw them out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no you di-int.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I think I did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: W-why did you...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Say, we got to order some more apa-teezers this time. We ran out last year, remember?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes we should. I... you know what? I wanted one of those skillets of cheese, but when I got off stage, [turns to Kevin] someone had eaten all of them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video] To Oscar Martinez it's the "Show Me the Money" award! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael has taped every Dundies awards and now, he's making me look through hours of footage to find highlights.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [in video] That's supposed to be confidential.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video] He has the award-ah! ...it's a type of song that we are going to play for the ladies. Hit it, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Dwight starts playing the tune of "Mambo No. 5" by Lou Bega on his recorder]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing along to tune on video] A little bit of Paaam, all night long, a little bit of Angela on the thing...

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Somebody sits in front of the camera on the video, so even though nothing can be seen, Michael can still be heard]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video]...a little bit of Phyllis everywhere...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, this is the part where Kevin sat in front of the camcorder all night. It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on video] ...a little bit of Roooy eating chicken crispers... ...a little bit of Jim with some ribs, a little bit of...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It was you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Live and learn.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [quietly laughing] It wasn't. I swear.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, what's the joke? You're not perfect either.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not laughing at you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So who are we laughing at?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, just something somebody wrote.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who? Dave Barry?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [laughing] No. No, just something that was written in the ladies' room wall.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is it? Who wrote it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, it's kind of private.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [whispering] It's about Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is defacement of company property. So you better tell me. Kelly, if you tell me, you'll be punished less.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, now I'm laughing at you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking to the speakerphone] Will her highness, Jan Levinson-Gould, be descending from her corporate throne this evening to visit us lowly serfs here at Dunder Mifflin Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speaker phone] It's a, it's, it's a two and a half hour drive from New York, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you could take the bus. You could work on the way here. Sleep on the way home.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wuh... Come on, Jan. This is important. I mean, this is, this is, validation to my employees here that you and corporate approve of this. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, we don't approve of this Michael. I mean, y-you only had the budget for one office party a year, so... we're not paying for this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Michael looks at the camera and motions for the camera to leave the office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to camera] Could you...?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are you there Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm here, I just wanted to, uh, talk to you for a second about that.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Michael closes the blinds]

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The camera tries to find a crack in the blinds]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, what, ah, what is, I mean...

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The camera pans around to reception, Pam is listening]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...come on, Jan!

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The camera goes to a side of Michael's office where the blinds are still partially open]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're dropping an A-Bomb on me here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really? I'm dropping an atomic bomb on you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, I mean, what is...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You already had a party on May 5th for no reason.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No reason?! It was the 05 05 05 party...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And you had a luau....

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...it happens once every billion years.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And a tsunami relief fundraiser which somehow lost a lot of money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, no, that was a FUN raiser. I think I made that very clear in the fliers, fun, F-U-N.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I don't understand why anyone would have a tsunami FUN raiser, Michael. I mean, that doesn't even make sense.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I think a lot of people were very affected by the footage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a little character I like to do [places a green turban with a yellow feather on his head], it is, uh, loosely based on Karnack, one of Carson's classic characters. [puts an envelope to his head] Here we go. The PLO, the IRA, and the hot dog stand behind the warehouse. [tears open envelope and pulls out card] "Name three businesses that have a better health care plans than Dunder Mifflin." Here's the problem. There's no open bar because of Jan and it's the reason why comedy clubs have a two drink minimum. It'll be fine, I just...wish people were going to be drunk.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Phyllis catches Dwight trying to sneak into the girls bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight, get out of here!!

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The door swings open and Dwight is being pushed out by Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What were you doing in the ladies room?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...no, no, no, no, it's not what you think.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why were you peering over the stalls?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, why were you in there?!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You are a pervert!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What were you doing in there?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You, are, a pervert!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video] The Dundie award for "Longest Engagement" goes to Pam Beesley.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, everybody! [starts clapping]

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam just sits there stirring her drink, rolls her eyes and glances over at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Jim, at the adjacent table, crosses his arms and glances over at Pam, both look annoyed]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoooo! When is that girl gonna get married? That's what I have to say. Ah, Roy's accepting.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [on video] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on video] Thank you Roy. Are there any words you'd like to say, on Pam's behalf?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [on video] Ah, w-we'll see you next year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on video] Yeah, oh, hope not! Oh God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not changing that, it's the best one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's hilarious, you're right. I just think, um, "world's longest engagement", um, we're all expecting it, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's why it's funny. Every year that Roy and Pam don't get married, it gets funnier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well I think if you use the same jokes it just comes across as lazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, [taking it to heart] lazy. Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, everyone, could I have your attention please. I just wanted to say that the women in this office are terrible. Especially the ones who wrote that stuff about Michael on the bathroom wall. Having a bathroom is a privilege. It is called a ladies room for a reason. And if you cannot behave like ladies, well then you are not going to have a bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're taking away our bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We are going to have two men's rooms.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But where would we...go?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Be prepared to hold folks [Michael comes out of his office] From 9 am to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...Dwight is banning us from our bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, that's just ridiculous, so just don't, I-I don't have time for this right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nnnnno, there needs to be repercussions...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just don't, don't talk-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...for people's behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't talk-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And it's-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just STAP IT YAP IT!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, look, I know there have been a lot of rumors flying around about the Dundies this year. How there is no money, and how there is no food, and how the jokes are really bad, but WHAT THE HELL EVERYBODY!? I mean, God. The Dundies are about the best, in every, one of us. Can't you see that? I mean, okay, we can do better. so, tonight, for the first time, we are inviting all of your friends and family to attend the awards with us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [with a small fist pump] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, not bad, right? So let's make this the best Dundies ever.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clapping] Best Dundies ever.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome to the eighth annual Dundies awards.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Quick cut to everybody talking and ignoring Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Before we get started, a few announcements. Keep your acceptance speeches short, I have wrap it up music, and I'm not afraid to use it. [points] Devon!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "The Dundies, how can I explain it? Awards you like to hate it. I'm psyched you all made it. You never had to work so hard and feel that no one notices you. You're just a name and number and no one even says hello." [to Ryan] Card!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The Dundies are kind of like a kid's birthday party, and you go, and there's really nothing for you to do there. But the kid's having a really good time, so you're, kind of there. That's-that's kind of what it's like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "You down with The Dundies? You down with the Dundie-"

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The music stops, Michael looks back at Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The waitress tripped on the cord.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, alright, joke landed. So we are here, thank you all for coming to the 2005 Dundie awards. [takes off sweater to reveal tuxedo] I am your host, Michael Scott. And I just want to tell you please, please, do not drink and drive. Because you may hit a bump and spill the drink!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to waitress] Oh, just put these on the group tab.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, actually this year, ah, no group tab, we're going to be doing separate checks.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You said, we could bring our families.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did. And why didn't ya Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I did, my wife's name is Terri.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm looking forward to meeting Terri.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's this person who's hand I'm holding Michael.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Michael is dumbfounded, Dwight pushes a button on his keyboard that says, "OHHH, YEAHHHH."]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Dwight, in a low voice] Shut it. [normal voice] Um, good. Speaking of relationships, of all, all way shapes and forms. Um, I was out on a very, very hot date with a girl from HR, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? We don't have any girls from HR.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that...for the sake of the story. And things were getting hot and heavy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I was about to take her bra off...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...when she made me fill out six hours of paperwork-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like an AIDS test?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! [under his breath] God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Alright, so let's get this party staaaarrrrted.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey let's go to Poor Richard's.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, guys, where you going? Pam, show's just getting started.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You staying?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, gotta eat somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And now... to someone who quietly goes about their job, but always seems to land the biggest accounts...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...the "Busiest Beaver" award goes to Phyllis Lapin.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Everybody starts clapping, Phyllis gets out of her booth and makes her way to Michael, she gives Jim a high five along the way]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, way to go Phyllis. Nice work, per usual.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This says "Bushiest Beaver".

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? I told them busiest...idiots.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's, it's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we'll fix it up. You don't have to display that.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam and Roy are at the truck, arguing.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...because that's what happens every time!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: ...talking about? He's a jackass every year.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [Put's his hand on Pam's arm] Come on, we're going to Poor Richard's.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Breaks Roy's grip] No, I don't want to go, I don't want to.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Pam. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you would have asked me that, then you would know.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Michael has false teeth in and glasses with squinted eyes on them]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in a stereotypical oriental accent] Herro everybodeeee. I'm gonna cwall Jan Revinson-Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! How are ya? I thought you left?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no, I just, I decided to stay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll just get a ride home from Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh good, I'm just in time for Ping.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [doing impression] Oh, dat wir be fwar. Ah, me so horny.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The camera zooms to an Asian customer behind Michael, she is looking at Michael in disbelief]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right? You know wat I'm talking 'bout.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to an off camera waiter and still clutching Jim's beer] Can I get a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This next award goes to somebody, who really, lights up the office.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Cut to Pam still drinking the beer]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Somebody, who I think a lot of us, cannot keep, from checking out. The "Hottest in the Office" award goes to... ...Ryan the temp!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. [singing to music] "Hidy ho, you sexy thang. You sexy thang you." Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What am I going to do with the award? Nothing. I-I don't know what I'm going to do. That's the least of my...concerns right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the "Tight Ass" award goes to Angela. Not only because she is everybody's favorite stickler, but because she has, a great caboose. So...come on down.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam starts sipping an empty glass] I think those might be empty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no. 'Cause the ice melts and then it's like second drink! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Second drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The "Spicy Curry" award goes to our very own Kelly Kapoor! Get on up here. Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: "Spicy Curry", what's that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, not everything means something, it's just a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but why'd you give it to me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, it's just...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This is a bowler-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. It's ju- they didn't have any more businessmen. So...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but everyone else-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just sit down Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sweaty and chugging water from a bottle] It's so freakin' hot in there. Now I know what Bob Hope was going through when he performed in Saudi Arabia. Man! I got Dwight sucking the funny out of the room, but you do what you can do. [Music starts playing in the background] Here we go, he's early with the cue. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael is singing to the tune of "Tiny Dancer" by Elton John] "You have won a tiny Dundie."

Quote.Speaker: Guy at bar
Quote.Text: Sing it Elton.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, thanks guys. Hey, where you guys from?

Quote.Speaker: Other Guy at Bar
Quote.Text: We just came from yo' mama's house.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, alright, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Guy At Bar
Quote.Text: Sing 'em a song dude.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, you know what guys, we're just having a little office party, so if you want, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Something flies by Michael] Hey, you know, cool it guys, really-

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [The guy at the bar throws another object, looks like a wad of wet napkins, this time it hits Michael on the shoulder]

Quote.Speaker: Guy At Bar
Quote.Text: You suck man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's cut it. [Dwight turns the music off]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] [with a lot less enthusiasm] I had a few more Dundies to, uh, give out tonight, but, I'm just going to cut it short. And wrap it up so everybody can enjoy their food. Um...thanks for listening, those who listened. [clears throat] This last Dundie is for Kevin, this is the "Don't Go in There After Me" award. It's for the time that I went into the bathroom after him, and it was really, really smelly. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [give Kevin his award]There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yay Kevin. Whoo hoo for Kevin! For stinking up the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [starts clapping] Yeah, alright Kev.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [More people start clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Woo! Hey, I haven't gotten one yet!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, I have not gotten one either. So, keep going.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: More Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: Pam and Jim
Quote.Text: [clapping] Dundies! Dundies! Dundies! Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Dundies! Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [getting his spirit back] Alright, alright, alright, okay. Alright, we'll keep rolling. Okay, this is the fine work award. This goes to Stanley, for all the fine work he did this year.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Fine work! Fine work Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know you did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here here! Speech, speech, speech, speech [other people start joining in]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well, well, last year, I got great work, so I don't...

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam starts laughing her cute drunk laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So, I don't know what to think about this award. But at least I didn't get smelliest bowel movement like Kevin. [starts chuckling]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And this next award is going out to our own little Pam Beesley...

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Cut to Pam, her face goes from drunken elation to sober realization]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...I think we all know what award Pam is going to be getting this year.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Cut to Jim's reaction of scared expectation]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is the "Whitest Sneakers" award! Because she always has the whitest tennis shoes on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get on down here! Pam Beesley ladies and gentlemen! [Pam grabs the microphone from him] Oh, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have so many people to thank for this award.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Quick cut to Jim laughing and staring at Pam with amused wonder]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, first off, my Keds. Because I couldn't have done it without them. [people clap] Thank you. Let's give Michael a round of applause for MC-ing tonight because [people start clapping again] this is a lot harder than it looks. And also because of Dwight too.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Dwight stands up, but nobody claps]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, so, finally, I want to thank God. Because God gave me this Dundie.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Quick cut to Jim, he's doesn't know whether to laugh or take her seriously, so he gives her an amused/appreciative grin]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And, I feel God in this Chili's tonight. WHOOOOOOOO!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam Beesley ladies and gentleman. [Pam hugs Michael and gives him a quick peck on the cheek] Oh! Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What a great year for the Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We got to see Ping. [Pam nods] And we learned of Michael's true feelings for Ryan. [Pam nods] Which was touching. And, we heard Michael change the lyrics to a number of classic songs. [Pam nods] Which for me, has ruined them for life. [looks at Pam, who is staring at him, nodding]

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Jim looks at the camera, then back at Pam, who is still nodding]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know, what?

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam starts laughing, then suddenly falls off the bar stool]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God! You are so drunk!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you get that? Please tell me you got that. This is all going to be on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Quick, quick, the woman is having a seizure. Grab her tongue, grab her tongue! It's okay, I'm a sheriff's deputy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's a volunteer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't get into that now. We need something to cushion her head. Throw pillow? A cush-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight come on, come-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's okay, I'm going to use my shirt.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Dwight starts taking off his shirt, but gets stuck]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, get off me!

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [A Chili's employee comes over, Jim helps Pam up, Dwight is stuck in his shirt]

Quote.Speaker: Employee
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, you're gonna have to put your clothes back on, people are trying to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [struggling] Ahh! I can't-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was this year's Dundies a success? Well, let's see, I made Pam laugh so hard, that she fell out of her chair, and she almost broke her neck. So I killed, almost.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just want to say, that this was the best, Dundies, ever! WHOOOOOOOOO!!!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa, careful, careful.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [We have a strict policy here not to over serve. Apparently, this young woman was sneaking drinks off other people's tables. I Xeroxed her driver's license and she is not welcome to this restaurant chain ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great work tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watch your step.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks, I had to, uh, check her pupils to make sure there wasn't a concussion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, that too, but I mean with the audio. Great work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel bad about what I wrote on the bathroom wall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, here she is. Careful, careful, whoa. Alright, easy. Almost there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, um, can I ask you a question?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Pam stares at Jim for a little while, then glances at the camera, realizes she's on camera]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I just wanted to say thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not really a question. [starts to laugh] Okay, let's get you home, you're drunk.

Quote.Speaker: None
Quote.Text: [Jim opens the door for her]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Goodnight, have a good night. Thank you Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: TMI. Too much information. I used to say, "Don't go there," but that is so lame now. Or, "You go, girl." Or... Um, when did "Where's the beef?" That was, like, a long, long time ago. It's funny how the shelf life of these things, like how long they last, like, "Too much information" probably came on the scene... I mean, I didn't hear it till, like, this month, so it's pretty recently. Um, but you know, they're generally good for, like, no more than five or six years.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes, that's true. I have never won a Dundie. I am more than okay with that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think I'm gonna share some Cadillac Fajitas with Toby. Toby is so cute, except he has that stupid kid.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm the designated driver, which is very important. We need everyone to get home safely. [sighs] But no one ever gives me gas money, and people live all over. It's expensive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Like a gaggle of geese... [jibbering mockingly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, we need something for Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do we know about him? He's an accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He plays guitar, he likes naval history. He's a bowler.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Jim] He's fat. The fat accountant award.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you seem to have this under control.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The weird part about this whole deal this that Michael truly believes that these awards are inspiring and motivational. I mean, he puts more effort and time and commitment into the Dundies than anything else he does all year. Which is probably why this branch will be downsized.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am the fat accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I need to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here he is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just thought that you might like to know that someone has written something about you on the ladies' room wall.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? What did they say? "For a good time, call Michael Scott"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, no, no. No, I think something bad, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you think that? You just immediately go to that, Dwight? Why are you so negative? Why...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean, you just come in and you're just negative...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...and you just walk negatively.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want me to find out what it says?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: By any means necessary?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What does that even mean? What are you... What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's the ladies' room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just go and find out what it says and who said it and report back to me. But don't tell anybody that I have anything to do with it because if they ask me, I will say that you are crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. You won't regret this, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What award would you like to give Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hadn't planned on including him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It hasn't always been easy being a whistleblower. When I was in school, the kids would call me a tattle-tale or a snitch or a worm. So I really identify with those women from Enron. I wrote them letters to tell them how much they inspired me, but they never wrote back. I guess they're all married.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela, it's simple. Just tell me what the bathroom wall says.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't talk about what goes on in the restroom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not asking what you do in there. I just want to know what's written about Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't says those kinds of things out loud. It's inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll talk. You nod if I get it right. Does it have to do with his butt or his wiener?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think his characters are pretty funny. Especially Ping.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, what should I do, guys? Seriously, do you want me to just cancel the Dundies?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, we were just hoping you wouldn't do those characters, like last time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ping? Everybody loves Ping. He's my most popular character.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think many people find that character slightly racist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Well, he is based on the Chinese delivery guy that I have, who talks exactly like that, so, I think you should take it up with him instead of me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Look, I'm just saying that there are many people that are offered by your insensitive skits.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Well, neither of you are Chinese, so what... Why do you care?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight, get out of here!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You can't be in here!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not what you think.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Shut up. You're a freak!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm on official business.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You are...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is Dunder Mifflin...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm telling Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Phyllis, you're not...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm telling Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis, no. No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis, no, no. Do not listen to her. She's out of her mind.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight was in the ladies' room and he was looking at me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is not true.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He was looking at me in the ladies' room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's totally unfair. I was just in the ladies' room in order to spy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you've hit a new low here.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's what I said. He was spying in the ladies' room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think, Phyllis? You think I followed you in there? Like, "Oh good. Phyllis is going to the bathroom, so maybe I get to see her naked from the waist down." I'm not even attracted to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a good point.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Write him up or I'll take it to Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, all right, I will do that. I will get to that definitely. Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. Maybe after I finish writing, producing, directing, and hosting your awards show. All right, just relax, keep your pants on. Unless, of course, you're in the bathroom and you should be able to take your pants off in that case without Creepsville Central spying on you. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, let's wrap it up. Come on, we're late. The Dundies are starting very soon. Accounting, let's go, let's go. Okay, I gave you fair warning. [turns off their computers] Out. Who's next, customer service? Meredith, let's roll.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. [organizing his costumes] And that. [to waitress] Hey. How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] You down with the Dundies?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] You down with the Dundies?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Dundies!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] You down with the Dundies? You're all my homies

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] You down with the Dundies?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Yeah, all the homies

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have listened to that song so many times and I still don't know what OPP stands for. Other people's... Something. I... [shakes head]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So, Pam, I wonder who's gonna get "longest engagement" this year.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Well. You're not goona get longest engagement, man, 'cause we got that locked up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I wonder what I'll get. I brought my fiance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, our next award... ah, yes, this award goes to the most creative writing on the ladies' room wall, and the winner is... Who is it? Who wants to claim it? Shiny Dundie. Who wrote it? Great idea, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm just saying I don't think it's appropriate for you to have given Ryan that award.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's hot, all right? What do you want me to do about it?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, that is fine to feel, but not to act on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighing] It was unanimous, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It wasn't a vote. You decided.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay, I based it on what I felt was unanimous office sentiment, and this isn't even about what Ryan thinks. It's about you. It's about how you feel about the Dundies. Admit it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, that is not true.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, it is true.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: 'Cause Ryan asked me to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I don't have time for this. I need to get on stage and you are breaking my concentration. [imitating Native chant] Me Chief Michael Scott. Here to trade...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, Goldschlager, extra flakes.

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: We don't have that. You want a Presidente Margarita? Blue Pacific Margarita, El Nino...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no. No margarita. Hot sake.

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: [shakes head 'no']

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fosters in the big can.

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: [shakes head 'no' again]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just a chocolate shake, chocolate sprinkles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. No, no, no, no, no. Lie still, lie still.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, this is crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, not now! We need to cushion her head. Lie still. Please, Pam. Do not move.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] I am fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, don't interfere.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: You have to put your clothes back on. People are trying to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can you give me a second, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, let me up.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Put your clothes back on. Get, get right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a Sheriff's Deputy.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: That's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could have my men in here in a second and have you arrested.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The other volunteers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, are you all right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Sir, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How many fingers am I holding up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're holding up three fingers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right. Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Put your clothes on, right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will. I will. You need to calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't wanna forget that.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: You and your party really need to leave right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Is this mine or is this Chili's?

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: You know what? Don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep it. My gift. [hugs Chili's Manager] Thank you. Have a good night. See you next year.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: That's fine.
